author: .vbuterin
content: I think the case for SSF over few-SF is just simplicity

author: .vbuterin
content: If you do few-SF there's still a whole bunch of protocol machinery that you have to lug around to deal with the slot/epoch distinction

author: .vbuterin
content: As well as fork choice complexities etc

author: .vbuterin
content: Also, from a UX point of view, it's less confusing for users to go straight to "finalized"

author: .vbuterin
content: Oh also also, SSF gives stronger anti-MEV-reorging guarantees, because the next auction doesn't even end until the previous slot is finalized
